intro: Anthonotha xanderi, commonly known as the Xander's anthonotha, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
